summary:
Isabella Ruggiero was born and raised in Naples, Italy. She studied at the University of Federico II in Naples, Italy, where she graduate in Political Sciences, and at the Istituto Universitario Orientale, where she studied Foreign languages and Literaures with cinematographic address (Aesthetics of Cinema, History and Criticism of Cinema, Semiotics of Cinema).

In the 2000 she moved to Holland, where she studied Oriental dance at Kaouthar Darmoni School. She travelled trough Europe and Middle East to study Oriental dance with great masters such as Sema Yldiz , Farida Famy, Mamhoud Reda, Mo Geddawi, Farouk Moustafa, Nevein Ramez, Raqia Hassan, Hassan Khalil, Suraya Hilal.

The real change, in her career, was the encounter with the Egyptian master percussionist Hossam Ramzy and his wife, the oustanding dancer Serena from who was auditioned and suggested to enrol in their prestigious International Music & Dance School, in London. She enroled in December 2010 and is about to complete the course at the Ramzy School.

In the 2008, meanwhile, she started researching the traditional music and dance from her region, Campania, in south of Italy. She became a connoisseur of la Tammurriata, a combined musical form made of sound, sung and dance and started developing her project as traditional south of Italy dance teacher and performer in the Netherlands.

In the 2009 Isabella won the first prize of the cross-over dance competition Shimmy Shake in Amsterdam, performing a Tammurriata piece with “Duo Tarante Basse”.

At the moment Isabella holds weekly classes of Oriental dance. Give monthly workshops of La Tammurriata. She is artistic director of “Folkendammer” a 3-day festival of traditional Italian music and dance, performs dance pieces with Mediterranean music ensembles like Dar al Mouzika and Luciano Maio quartet. Organizes artistic residencies with the aim of create a bridge between Mediterranean culture and local culture and to spread south of Italy traditions abroad.

profile_positions.description:
Danzeasud is a project by Isabella Ruggiero dancer, trainer, researcher and choreographer of  southern Italian traditional dances and Oriental (Egypt & Middle East) dances, based in Amsterdam, the Netherlands.
Isabella organizes, during the year, Italian traditional music & dance events and artistic residencies with the aim of create a bridge between Mediterranean and local culture.

Mediterranean is the ultimate place for the exchange of culture and commerce.
Arts, crafts, ways of living, expressions, habits are similar as well as dance and music have invisible threads that underlie.
Danzeasud’s aim is to re-weave the thread and raise awareness of the relationships between Mediterranean musical cultures, focusing on southern Italian and Egypt & Middle Eastern traditional music & dances.
profile_positions.title: Dancer
